column5: How China Has Added to Its Influence Over the iPhone
column6: Apple is taking small steps toward India. But the production of its latest phone, set for introduction on Wednesday, shows how difficult it will be to make big changes.

column5: A ‘Virtual Rapper’ Was Fired. Questions About Art and Tech Remain.
column6: Young people are increasingly at ease consuming culture via digital avatars or made with artificial intelligence. Should the same moral guidelines and laws apply to those works?

column5: Apple, the Ad Critic, Now Embraces Ads
column6: Apple has long supported privacy and shunned those intrusive ads. What happens when it sells more ads, too?

column5: Signal, the encrypted messaging app, appoints a president.
As Ex-Uber Executive Heads to Trial, the Security Community Reels
column6: Joe Sullivan, Uber’s former chief of security, faces criminal charges for his handling of a 2016 security breach. His trial this week has divided the security industry.
